description:
You are given an array of integers `nums`, and there is a sliding window of size `k` which is moving from the very left of the array to the very right. You can only see the `k` numbers in the window. Each time the sliding window moves right by one position.

Return the max sliding window — an array of the maximum value in each window position.

examples.explanation: Single element — the only window contains just that element.

testCases.explanation: Sliding windows of size 3: max values are 3,3,5,5,6,7.
Single element, window size 1 — result is [1].
